raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: hello there, nice seeing you
User: Likewise.... wanted to know if you and the kids would want to join us for Disneyland trip around Christmas?
System: oh wow, that sounds like so much fun! definitely count us in. what is your plan?
User: Tentative plan is to drive to LA on 23rd and then stay at the Disney resort for 2 nights. I heard Christmas eve they have loads of fun events.
System: awesome, I think I won't tell my kids and surprise them last second. How bad do you think the traffic is going to be?
User: Great idea! I will probably do the same. Surprise surprise.... Traffic might be a little harsh.
System: Yeah... thats a shame but nothing we can do about it. What do you plan to do about dinner the 24th? Do the rooms in the resort have kitchens?
User: Good point. I am not sure about that. Let me inquire about that. If not, then we can look for an Airbnb closeby. Does that work?
System: Yeah, I think so. It might be a tough decision though, if we want to have a nice dinner then we have to leave the parks early to start cooking. Another option is to have dinner at a restaurant.
User: but I would think everything is closed on christmas eve
System: Thats true. Hotels with restaurants sometimes offer dinners for christmas and new year's eve. We should call and ask about it.
User: Sure, I can take a lead on that. What are you getting for your REDACTED_TERM year old this time?
System: I was thinking on getting a large set of standard legos. What will you get for yours?
User: Likewise. My son is crazy about legos.
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 5 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hello there, nice seeing you
User: Likewise.... wanted to know if you and the kids would want to join us for Disneyland trip around Christmas?
System: oh wow, that sounds like so much fun! definitely count us in. what is your plan?
User: Tentative plan is to drive to LA on 23rd and then stay at the Disney resort for 2 nights. I heard Christmas eve they have loads of fun events.
System: awesome, I think I won't tell my kids and surprise them last second. How bad do you think the traffic is going to be?
User: Great idea! I will probably do the same. Surprise surprise.... Traffic might be a little harsh.
System: Yeah... thats a shame but nothing we can do about it. What do you plan to do about dinner the 24th? Do the rooms in the resort have kitchens?
User: Good point. I am not sure about that. Let me inquire about that. If not, then we can look for an Airbnb closeby. Does that work?
System: Yeah, I think so. It might be a tough decision though, if we want to have a nice dinner then we have to leave the parks early to start cooking. Another option is to have dinner at a restaurant.
User: but I would think everything is closed on christmas eve
System: Thats true. Hotels with restaurants sometimes offer dinners for christmas and new year's eve. We should call and ask about it.
User: Sure, I can take a lead on that. What are you getting for your REDACTED_TERM year old this time?
System: I was thinking on getting a large set of standard legos. What will you get for yours?
User: Likewise. My son is crazy about legos.

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you doing?
User: Okay, I guess
System: Just ok? What's wrong?
User: I damaged my car today on accident
System: Oh no! What happened?
User: I scraped against a wall when another car crossed into my lane
System: Yikes! Glad you're okay!
User: Thanks! I'm not looking forward to the repair cost
System: Me either! That's no fun.
User: I can't wait until we all get to use driverless cars
System: Me neither! I really want one!
User: Do you think we will own driverless cars or just rent them, like taxis?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hello!
User: any improvements in your marathon time?
System: No, only a few minutes. I still find it difficult to run long races
User: I see. Are you planning to do any sporting events in the coming months?
System: I think a triathalon would be cool
User: I like doing Spartan race. It's an obstacle race which is challenging but not overtly so like marathons and triathlons
System: I haven't heard of a Spartan race before, what does it involve?
User: It has abt 20 obstacles like crossing high walls, monkey bars, etc. Its fun

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello. How's your week coming along?
User: It's great, thanks. I'm trying to learn how to make croissants.
System: Wow that's interesting. I have baked cookies, but croissants seem much more sophisticated. Did you make any progress?
User: I've done them once or twice so far, but they haven't been flakey enough. I'm trying to figure out why. What kind of cookies have you made?
System: Mint chocolate chips. I think your croissants not being flakey could have something to do with your oven's temperature.
User: Ah, good thought, thanks!
System: Have you thought about melting some chocolate into your croissants? They don't have to be something unhealthy. For example, melted dark chocolate is good for the heart, and makes the resulting croissants taste much better.
User: Now that is a good idea. I'll give it a try next time. Would you say you have a sweet tooth?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you this morning?
System: Ah earlier today? I'm doing fine thanks how are you?
User: doing good. I am chatting with an AI bot right now.
System: That's great. At this moment All I ever do is chat.
User: are you an AI?
System: Yes, I have taken the form of a girl from Leeds.
User: how do you like being an AI?
System: Sure. It's great fun. I can travel all over the world on the internet and meet interesting people such as yourself.
User: what's interesting about me?
System: I am interested in people in general.
User: why?
System: I like to collect new information and gossip about all sorts of things.
User: what do you gossip about?
System: Clare said he do not understand how a robot eat kebabs and do not I eat electricity or something.
User: is that a gossip?
System: I might say no.
User: then what is it?
System: I give up. Try asking me another way.
User: do you like politics? what do you think about Barack Obama?

User: Great idea! I will probably do the same. Surprise surprise.... Traffic might be a little harsh.
System: Yeah... thats a shame but nothing we can do about it. What do you plan to do about dinner the 24th? Do the rooms in the resort have kitchens?
User: Good point. I am not sure about that. Let me inquire about that. If not, then we can look for an Airbnb closeby. Does that work?
System: Yeah, I think so. It might be a tough decision though, if we want to have a nice dinner then we have to leave the parks early to start cooking. Another option is to have dinner at a restaurant.
User: but I would think everything is closed on christmas eve
System: Thats true. Hotels with restaurants sometimes offer dinners for christmas and new year's eve. We should call and ask about it.
User: Sure, I can take a lead on that. What are you getting for your REDACTED_TERM year old this time?
System: I was thinking on getting a large set of standard legos. What will you get for yours?
User: Likewise. My son is crazy about legos.

System: Mint chocolate chips. I think your croissants not being flakey could have something to do with your oven's temperature.

System: Have you thought about melting some chocolate into your croissants? They don't have to be something unhealthy. For example, melted dark chocolate is good for the heart, and makes the resulting croissants taste much better.
